content: If my PR is approved and then I make a change, does it have to be re-approved? I'm assuming yes.
Sorry if I'm asking too many questions, let me know if I am!
(don't worry about asking questions, there's plenty of people that can answer them while waiting for a build)
If you feel like you're bothering people, read the "A metaquestion" topic in #t-compiler :D
A lot of compiler experts said that questions never bother them
Should I notify my reviewer somehow or will they just re-approve it?

LeSeulArtichaut said:

If you feel like you're bothering people, read the "A metaquestion" topic in #t-compiler :D

I read some of that thread but I just wanted to make sure :)

Camelid said:

Should I notify my reviewer somehow or will they just re-approve it?

Generally, they will come around to it again (because it's still assigned to them on github). Some reviewers (e.g. eddyb) also say you can ping them on zulip because they don't see gh pings as easily, but it depends on who.
